sentence.text: Hereditary angioedema (HAE), due to negative regulation of cell migration-inhibitor deficiency, is a rare autosomal dominant and potentially life-threatening disease characterised by recurrent oedema attacks of skin, mucosa and viscera.

Due to the rarity and the transcription elongation from RNA polymerase II promoter that symptoms of HAE imitate other forms of angioedema and other conditions, HAE may be misdiagnosed, especially in emergency settings.

entity.text: transcription elongation from RNA polymerase II promoter
